title: Indiana rallies to stay unbeaten in 'improbable' win
content: No. 2 Indiana scores on an improbable Omar Cooper Jr. toe-top touchdown catch with 36 seconds remaining to avoid its first loss of the season and beat Penn State 27-24.

title: Sources: Poison pill blocks Parsons trade to Philly
content: The trade that sent Micah Parsons from Dallas to Green Bay has a "poison pill" condition that prevents the two-time All-Pro from playing for the Eagles in the immediate future, sources told ESPN.

title: Elko bristles at past, urges 9-0 Aggies to 'finish'
content: Texas A&M keeps defying its recent history of weak finishes, scoring another road win and moving to 9-0 for the first time since 1992 with a 38-17 rout of Missouri.

title: Boozer twins start strong in home debut for Duke
content: Cameron and Cayden Boozer thrived in their home debut at Duke, with Cameron going for 25 points, 8 rebounds and 5 assists in a blowout win over Western Carolina.

title: Messi's brace leads Miami to 1st playoff series win
content: Lionel Messi's first-half brace propelled Inter Miami to a 4-0 victory over Nashville SC to advance in the MLS playoffs for the first time in club history.

title: Texas Tech LB Rodriguez flashes Heisman pose
content: Texas Tech linebacker Jacob Rodriguez struck a Heisman Trophy pose during another dominating defensive performance by the ninth-ranked Red Raiders, leading his club to a stifling 29-7 Big 12 victory over previously undefeated No. 8 BYU on Saturday.

title: ‚öæ Sources: Japanese home run king Murakami posts

title: üìà Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Bama top CFP ranking
content: In the first rankings of the College Football Playoff, coach Ryan Day and unbeaten Ohio State topped the list, followed by Big Ten foe Indiana at No. 2 with Texas A&M third and Alabama landing at four.

title: ‚öæ Former MLB star Strawberry pardoned by Trump
content: President Donald Trump has pardoned former MLB great Darryl Strawberry, the 1983 NL Rookie of the Year and an eight-time All-Star, of tax evasion and drug charges dating back to the latter part of his playing career.

title: Chaotic Man United vs. Spurs finale another roller coaster of emotions for fans
content: Tottenham fans thought their team had come from behind to beat Manchester United, only to concede a 96th-minute equalizer in a 2-2 draw.

content: Can the Bucs reach the Super Bowl? Will Myles Garrett win DPOY? We asked 15 experts to give their predictions for the rest of the season.

title: Keegan-Michael Key talks to Panthers after Rico Dowdle's pump fine
content: The actor, whose pelvic pump comedy sketch on "Key and Peele" aired in 2013, also donated $15,000 to Dowdle's GoFundMe.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea, Spurs tracking Juventus striker David
content: Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur are poised to make a move for Canada international striker Jonathan David. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Cyclone Montha floods Veligonda project, restoration work under way

title: Registration not mandatory, we are recognised as a body of individuals: RSS chief
content: When asked whether Muslims and Christians are allowed to join the RSS, Mohan Bhagwat said they were welcome but with one condition: that they should identify themselves as the children of Bharat Mata

title: Special Intensive Revision: Kerala likely to complete  distribution of enumeration forms by November 25

title: Koramangala shows the way: Footpaths earn a ‚Äòthumbs up‚Äô in walkability test
content: The walk was part of the Project Walkaluru, a citizen initiative aimed at identifying and celebrating the city‚Äôs best pedestrian infrastructure

title: Family of deceased woman alleges medical negligence
content: Shivapriya had delivered a boy at the SAT hospital on October 22. She died after developing severe diarrhoea and fever soon after

title: State must show ‚Äòmanifest‚Äô transparency, fairness in issues of religious oppression, SC judge observes
content: Justice Sanjay Kumar makes the remark while rejecting a plea by the Maharashtra government to review a September verdict on the constitution of an SIT to investigate a case in the backdrop of the Akola communal riots of 2023

content: ‚ÄòParents, apart from being compassionate coaches, should also focus on triade of sleep, nutrition and movement‚Äô

title: Sugarcane FRP in Karnataka: Ensuring mills pay what is mandated is a tough task
content: This is owing to the ownership pattern of sugar mills in the State, many of which are owned by powerful political families from across the political spectrum, and the prevailing Central laws

title: Jubilee Hills bypoll: All arrangements in place with drones and three-tier security to guard polling booths
content: The polling will be held from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., with an additional hour permitted compared to previous elections

title: ‚ÄòWhere is the outrage?‚Äô Victims of Bihar‚Äôs debt crisis ask why their plight is not a poll issue

title: Chhattisgarh train accident: investigation confirms train overshot signal in red
content: A fact-finding report comprising senior railway officials drawn from various departments concluded that the accident came under the ‚ÄúSignal Passed At Danger‚Äù (SPAD) category.

title: In Dhamdaha, the contest is between ‚Äòloyalty‚Äô and ‚Äòbetrayal‚Äô
content: It‚Äôs a fight between heavyweights as Santosh Kushwaha, who quit the ruling JD(U) to join the RJD, is taking on Minister Lesi Singh of the JD(U), a five-term MLA from Dhamdaha. Ms. Singh is trying to portray Mr. Kushwaha as a ‚Äòbetrayer‚Äô, while Mr. Kushwaha bets on people‚Äôs will for a change.

title: KU Sanskrit HoD booked under SC/ST Act for alleged casteist remarks against research scholar
content: The case was registered after Vijayan accused Vijayakumari of refusing to sign his thesis and making derogatory comments since 2015, which he claims were influenced by her political affiliations.

title: Choose DGP from list sent by UPSC, Palaniswami urges DMK government
content: He alleges that Chief Minister M.K. Stalin has ‚Äúdeliberately appointed a DGP in-charge temporarily so as to delay the appointment of the DGP‚Äù, as the UPSC did not recommend junior officers who were likely to act at the behest of the DMK government, since many eligible senior police officers were waiting

title: State govt. committed to ensuring both welfare of farmers and safety of Tungabhadra dam: Shivakumar
content: The Deputy Chief Minister cautions people against falling prey to Opposition propaganda on water release for a second crop

title: Now silent on Bihar, Election Commission had halted two welfare schemes in Tamil Nadu during polls
content: The poll body, silent on the MMRY scheme launched 10 days before the Bihar Assembly polls, halted two welfare schemes in Tamil Nadu: the AIADMK government‚Äôs distribution of money orders to farmers in 2004, and DMK government‚Äôs free colour TV scheme in 2006

title: R&B Department launches Danish Tech NH project in Sathya Sai district
content: The initiative marks a major milestone for the district, which is emerging as a key connectivity hub linking the Rayalaseema region with major national corridors

title: Kerala Tourist Buses To Suspend Services To Karnataka, Tamil Nadu
content: The Luxury Bus Owners Association on Sunday announced that they will suspend all interstate services from Kerala to Karnataka and Tamil Nadu.

title: Pakistan Committed To "Dialogue" With Afghanistan After Latest Talks Fail
content: Pakistan said Sunday it was committed to "dialogue" with Afghanistan despite peace talks ending after deadly violence, with Islamabad stressing its security concerns persist.

title: Super Typhoon Fung-Wong Makes Landfall In Philippines
content: Super Typhoon Fung-wong slammed into the Philippines' eastern seaboard on Sunday, the national weather service said, after killing at least two people and forcing more than a million to evacuate their homes.

title: Doctor, 2 Others Arrested In Gujarat For Planning Ricin Terror Attack
content: The Gujarat Anti Terrorist Squad has busted a suspected terror syndicate by arresting a 'doctor' with a Chinese MBBS degree, who was allegedly preparing highly-lethal chemical poison, 'Ricin'.

title: Shashi Tharoor's LK Advani Post Gets A Congress Rebuttal
content: Shashi Tharoor speaks for himself, underlined the Congress, distancing itself from the party leader's remarks praising veteran BJP leader LK Advani.

title: "Every 3rd Child Has Damaged Lungs": Protest Over Air Pollution In Delhi
content: Scores of people, including parents and environmental activists, staged a protest at the India Gate on Sunday against the worsening air quality in the national capital.

title: Man Killed, His Son Loses Both Legs As Cop Allegedly Rams SUV Into Bikes In Madhya Pradesh
content: A policeman allegedly rammed his sports utility vehicle into multiple motorcycles in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch district, killing a college teacher and injuring his 10-year-old son, whose legs had to be amputated, and three others, an official said on

title: "We Are Against BJP": Prashant Kishor Rules Out Alliance In Bihar
content: Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor on Sunday ruled out any possibility of joining a coalition government if his party fails to secure an absolute majority in the Bihar Assembly elections.

title: Woman, Minor Daughter Attempt Suicide In Bengal, Family Alleges SIR Fear
content: A 27-year-old woman in West Bengal's Hooghly district allegedly attempted suicide along with her minor daughter, reportedly out of fear after not receiving a Special Intensive Revision (SIR) enumeration form, her family claimed on Sunday.

title: Furnace, "I Love You" Text: How Pune Man Tried To Cover Up Wife's Murder
content: In a shocking case from Pune that seemed like the plot of a Bollywood thriller, a man allegedly murdered his wife last month, burned her body in a makeshift furnace and then repeatedly visited the police station to mislead investigators.

title: 5.4 Magnitude Earthquake Recorded In Andaman Sea: Seismology Centre
content: An earthquake of 5.4 magnitude was recorded in the Andaman Sea on Sunday, the National Center for Seismology said.

title: Gold Prices Expected To Remain In Corrective Phase Ahead Of Crucial US Macrodata
content: Gold prices are expected to remain in a corrective phase in the coming week ahead of the crucial US inflation data, continuing uncertainties over trade tariffs and key economic numbers from China, analysts said.

title: Sheikh Hasina Aide's "Clinton-Yunus" Bombshell And A Big Charge Against USAID
content: A humanitarian agency of the US government and the Clinton family were behind the uprising in Bangladesh that led to Sheikh Hasina's ouster in 2024, a top aide of the former prime minister has alleged in an interview with Russia Today.

title: India-Nepal Border Points Closed For 72 Hours Ahead Of Bihar Phase 2 Polls
content: The border points along the Nepal-India border have been closed for 72 hours, starting Saturday, ahead of the second phase of the Bihar election.

title: Zohran Mamdani's Win Exposes Deep Rift In New York's Jewish Voters
content: Zohran Mamdani's election as New York's next mayor exposed a deepening rift between traditional Democratic Jewish voters and younger progressives - one that could reshape politics for years.

title: Exclusive: Inside Pak's Secret Unit 'S1' That Trains Terrorists To Attack India
content: A unit called "S1" in Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) has played a big role in exporting terror to India, way back from the Mumbai blasts in 1993 to the recent terror attack on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: Dance, Daru, Drama: More Lapses Emerge At Bengaluru Central Jail
content: In more trouble for the authorities at Bengaluru Central Jail, a video has now emerged showing inmates dancing and partying with liquor and snacks.

title: 122 Seats, 3.7 Crore Votes, Seemanchal Battle: Decoding Bihar Polls Phase 2
content: The battelines are drawn, positions taken, speeches delivered, and dice cast: in the next few hours, campaigning for the second and last phase of the Assembly polls in Bihar will come to an end. The second phase of polling will take place on Tuesday.

title: Mohan Bhagwat Was Asked If Muslims Are Allowed In RSS. His Response
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) supports policies, not an individual or a political party, its chief Mohan Bhagwat has said, adding that RSS workers would have even backed the Congress if it supported the demand for a Ram Temple in Ayodhya.

title: Turkish Delegation Heads To Pakistan To Broker Peace Deal With Afghanistan
content: Turkey's foreign and defence ministers and intelligence chief plan to travel to Pakistan this week to discuss its stop-start talks with Afghanistan on a ceasefire in South Asia, President Tayyip Erdogan said.

title: Transport Department seizes 102 private buses in Bengaluru during post-Kurnool safety crackdown
content: 13 enforcement teams were deployed across 10 key locations in the city, focusing primarily on Attibele and Devanahalli, two major entry and exit points into Bengaluru

title: Congress distances itself from Tharoor's remarks on Advani
content: Tharoor described Advani as a true statesman whose life of service has been exemplary; lawyer Sanjay Hegde replied unleashing the 'dragon seeds of hatred' (to quote Kushwant Singh) in this country is NOT public service."

title: Fake look-alike cab and auto aggregator apps duping passengers in Bengaluru
content: Passengers claim these counterfeit apps look identical to official interfaces of popular cab and auto aggregators, allowing drivers to manually alter fares and present inflated bills at the end of trips.

content: Association says some colleges continue collecting money from students and universities threaten cancellation of semester registrations due to non-release of funds

content: Spot bookings are extremely limited, and those arriving without prior booking may face long delays and inconvenience, say Kerala Police

content: Rahul Gandhi, addressing a poll rally in Bihar‚Äôs Kishanganj, also alleged that the BJP and RSS were trying to divide the nation, while the INDIA bloc was making efforts to unite the country.

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs hospitality sector sees growth, room rates increase over past 2 years
content: Stakeholders cite robust economic expansion, industrial growth, and rising travel demand as the driving factors. They say the demand in Chennai is coming from strong growth in the office and manufacturing segment

title: Record turnout at HCL Cyclothon Hyderabad 2025
content: Over 1,900 cyclists from across the country participated; event celebrated fitness, sustainability and community spirit while offering a prize purse of ‚Çπ33.6 lakh

content: Telangana Cyber Security Bureau officials says the accused had collectively enabled more than ‚Çπ95 crore in fraudulent transactions, linked to at least 754 crime links across India, including 128 cases traced to Telangana

content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM inaugurates a 20-acre Kumki training facility and unveils a comprehensive wildlife strategy backed by modern veterinary support, following 23 human deaths and extensive crop losses since 2021

content: DGP says that State has witnessed a steady increase in cyber crime over the past decade, prompting the police to initiate a campaign on a war footing to tackle the menace; states that that women, senior citizens and homemakers are increasingly being targeted by callers who use fear to commit fraud

content: The exchange formalises both institutes to undertake a comprehensive capacity-building programme for municipal administration personnel across seven States and two Union Territories

content: The party State secretary alleges that influential groups have encroached upon 700 acres of land allotted to tribal families in the Rayalacheruvu‚ÄìGandipeta region and calls for an inquiry into official collusion and forest land violations

title: Kerala Local Body Polls 2025: Both LDF, UDF harbour hopes in Kothamangalam
content: The rival fronts have each won the municipality twice since 2005. While the Assembly constituency has elected CPI(M) since 2016, in the parliamentary election, the Congress won a thumping majority. The ruling LDF hopes to continue its dominance and the UDF is eyeing a comeback. The BJP has no councillors in the outgoing council

title: Thriving ‚Äòneer maruthu‚Äô trees in Mudhumalai Tiger Reserve provide refuge for endangered vultures
content: Researchers enumerated the presence of more than 10,000 thriving Terminalia arjuna trees and noted the presence of 56 nests of White-rumped vultures in them.

title: China Eastern launches Shanghai-Delhi flight with near full capacity
content: China Eastern's Shanghai Pudong-Delhi route, operated by an Airbus A330 wide-body aircraft, will run three times a week on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays.

title: Wild tuskers clash in Bikkodu in Belur taluk
content: The elephants, named Bhima and Captain by local people, came face to face and hit each other. One of Bhima‚Äôs tusks broke and was disjointed in the fight.

content: The incident took place at 1.45 p.m. in the forested hills near Gogunda under Fulbagdi police station area when a team of security personnel was out on an area domination operation, a police official said

title: ‚ÄòLike always‚Äô: Cong distances itself from Tharoor‚Äôs praise for Advani; cites 'liberal spirit'
content: Congress has distanced itself from Shashi Tharoor's praise for BJP veteran L.K. Advani, calling his remarks his own. These comments followed after the Thiruvananthapuram MP defended Advani's long public service, comparing it to assessing Congress icons. This isn't the first time Tharoor's cross-party compliments have caused friction with the party leadership.

title: Joint power on play: Army conducts Exercise Brahma Shira in Rann, Creek Sector - video
content: The Army successfully conducted Exercise Brahma Shira in the Rann and Creek Sector as part of the Tri-Services Exercise Trishul. This joint drill involved the Army, Navy, Air Force, Coast Guard, and BSF, alongside civil administration, to enhance multi-domain operational capabilities. The exercise highlighted the Army's modernization efforts and integration of advanced infrastructure for challenging terrains.

title: Delhi pollution: Citizens protest against toxic air in Capital; demand action
content: Delhi residents, joined by AAP leader Priyanka Kakkar, protested at India Gate demanding government action on severe air pollution.  Protesters voiced anger over perceived government denial and inaction, highlighting the hazardous AQI levels. They called for concrete policies and transparency, criticizing failed experiments and urging for permanent solutions to protect citizens' lives.

title: Pro-Trump desis, caught in MAGA Civil War, flee from GOP
content: MAGA movement's nativist fervor is backfiring on Indian-American conservatives like Dinesh D'Souza and Kash Patel, who face xenophobic attacks from far-right groups. This internal conflict highlights the precarious position of minority allies within a movement built on white Christian nationalism, leading to potential GOP defections.

title: 'Why would Gen-Z listen to him?': PK questions Rahul's influence; downplays his impact
content: Prashant Kishor dismisses Rahul Gandhi's influence over Bihar's Gen Z voters, citing his limited engagement and understanding of the state. Kishor argues that Bihar's youth, driven by unemployment and migration, are politically active but not swayed by calls to protect democracy or accusations of vote theft. He also deems the Congress party's role in Bihar as marginal.

title: Bill Gates on foundation‚Äôs role; not replacing US aid: ‚ÄòThat‚Äôs not our job‚Äô
content: The Gates Foundation has pledged $2.5 billion over five years to advance global women's health, marking a significant increase in their investment. This funding will primarily support research and development for innovations like self-injectable contraceptives and rapid STI diagnostics, aiming to address long-overlooked health disparities and catalyze broader action.

title: ‚ÄòThey were holding a grudge‚Äô: Teen shoots schoolmate with father‚Äôs pistol; 2 accused arrested
content: A 17-year-old boy allegedly shot his schoolmate with his father's licensed pistol in Gurgaon's Sector 48, leaving the victim critically injured. The accused and another minor friend were apprehended shortly after the incident. Police recovered the weapon and ammunition from the rented accommodation, with the motive reportedly stemming from a two-month-old argument.

title: Who is Akash Kumar? Meghalaya batter who broke world record for fastest First-Class fifty
content: Meghalaya's Akash Kumar etched his name in cricketing history by smashing the fastest-ever First-Class fifty in just 11 balls during a Ranji Trophy match. The 25-year-old's explosive innings, featuring eight consecutive sixes, shattered the previous world record and stunned onlookers.  Kumar's remarkable feat has propelled him into global cricketing immortality.

title: ‚ÄòAnyone can buy Tesla stock right now‚Äô: Elon Musk sends open invite
content: Tesla shareholders approved Elon Musk's $1 trillion pay package, contingent on ambitious growth targets. Musk must achieve significant milestones in market value, revenue, and profitability, including a $400 billion EBITDA goal, to unlock the full payout. These challenging objectives underscore Musk's commitment to Tesla's future in AI and robotics.

title: Charlie Kirk‚Äôs leaked messages reveal Ben Shapiro‚Äôs jealousy of Candace Owens
content: Leaked texts reveal Charlie Kirk believed Ben Shapiro sought to sabotage his and Candace Owens' careers. Amidst this, Shapiro accused Owens of making "vile" claims, including alleging TPUSA insiders were involved in Kirk's death. Owens vehemently denied this, calling Shapiro a liar. Erika Kirk, Charlie's widow, urged caution with online speculation.

title: World Cup: 'I was just thinking ...' - Shafali Verma reveals mindset behind final heroics
content: Shafali Verma revealed her calm and focused mindset during India's ICC Women's World Cup final victory. Despite initial nerves on the big stage, she concentrated on executing her plans, prioritising the team's win over personal milestones. Verma also highlighted the importance of hard work, self-belief, and her family's support in her journey.

title: ‚ÄòRahul mentally unstable‚Äô: BJP slams MGB over ‚Äòpower greed‚Äô; counters 'vote-chori' claim
content: Uttar Pradesh deputy chief minister Keshav Prasad Maurya is confident of a massive majority for the NDA in Bihar. He stated the alliance led by Nitish Kumar will form the government. Maurya dismissed allegations of vote theft by the opposition. He believes the people of Bihar trust Prime Minister Modi and chief minister Nitish Kumar.

title: 'Success takes time': Nvidia CEO tells Zuckerberg- here's what he said
content: Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on AI's future and building tech empires. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out like Zuckerberg, while both acknowledged their long journeys and mutual admiration. Nvidia's remarkable rise to a $5 trillion valuation was highlighted, contrasting with Zuckerberg's own dorm-room beginnings leading to Meta's trillion-dollar status.

title: Can Muslims join RSS? Mohan Bhagwat answers; explains who is 'not allowed' in Sangh
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat stated the organization welcomes individuals from all faiths, including Muslims and Christians, provided they identify as "sons of Bharat Mata" and part of Hindu society. He clarified that the RSS focuses on unity and a shared national identity, not caste or religion, and defended its legal standing as a recognized organization.

title: Vande Mataram row: Congress hits back at PM with 'proof', says CWC followed Tagore's advice
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for linking the 1937 Vande Mataram statement to India's partition. Ramesh cited Mahatma Gandhi's collected works and Rabindranath Tagore's advice, stating the CWC's decision to use only the first two stanzas was to avoid religious references and unite against British rule.

title: World Cup hero Kranti Gaud‚Äôs dad to get back cop job
content: Madhya Pradesh chief minister Mohan Yadav has assured that Munna Singh Gaud, the father of women‚Äôs World Cup‚Äìwinning cricketer Kranti Gaud, will be reinstated as police constable. Gaud was dismissed in 2012 after an alleged error during election duty. The announcement came during Kranti‚Äôs felicitation ceremony in Bhopal, where the CM commended the bowler for bringing glory to the nation and her state.

title: Hong Kong Sixes: Pakistan create history! Become most successful team with six titles
content: Pakistan have claimed a record sixth Hong Kong Sixes title, defeating Kuwait in a dominant final.  After posting a strong total, Pakistan's bowlers expertly stifled Kuwait's chase, securing a memorable victory.  This triumph solidifies Pakistan's legacy as the most successful nation in the tournament's history, reclaiming supremacy after a 14-year gap.

title: Land deal row: Ajit Pawar defends son Parth again; terms charges 'random' accusations
content: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar defended his son Parth Pawar against allegations of irregularities in a Pune land deal, calling them "random accusations" ahead of local elections. He stated an inquiry is underway into the sale of government land to a company linked to his son, assuring the truth will emerge soon.

title: Oman declares Nov26‚Äì27 as extended national day holidays for public, private sectors
content: His Majesty Sultan Haitham bin Tarik has declared Wednesday, November 26, and Thursday, November 27, 2025, as official holidays for employees in both public and private sectors to mark Oman‚Äôs 55th National Day. The announcement reflects the Sultanate‚Äôs effort to modernize national observances while celebrating its heritage and advancing initiatives like Oman Vision 2040.

title: Star anise tea for warmth, digestive relief and respiratory comfort in the cold
content: Star anise evening tea is gaining popularity this cold season. Its warm, liquorice flavour provides comfort and digestive ease. While linked to antiviral research through shikimic acid, experts confirm it is a supportive wellness drink, not a medicine. Simple to prepare, this caffeine-free infusion offers relaxation and aids sleep. Always use authentic Chinese star anise for safety.

title: After PM Modi‚Äôs tattoo query: WC winner visits Mahakaleshwar ‚Äì Watch
content: Following India's maiden ICC Women's World Cup triumph, all-rounder Deepti Sharma visited the Mahakaleshwar Temple in Ujjain for the Bhasma-Aarti. Sharma, who was Player of the Tournament with 22 wickets, expressed her joy and dedicated her award to her parents. The team had previously visited the temple during the tournament.

title: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs ‚Äògoodbye‚Äô text hours before death highlights NFL crisis
content: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs death at 24 has forced the NFL to confront a serious mental health crisis. Police confirmed the Dallas Cowboys defensive end died by an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound after alarming messages to family. Coaches, teammates, and fans are grieving as dispatch audio reveals the severity of his final hours. Full details inside.

title: Klay Thompson apologizes to Megan Thee Stallion after airport pickup mishap
content: Dallas Mavericks star Klay Thompson went viral for his heartfelt apology and remorse after arriving late to pick up girlfriend Megan Thee Stallion from the airport. He presented her with flowers, expressing genuine regret, which fans found "adorably human." The couple's authentic connection continues to charm audiences as they both thrive in their careers.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife Lauren Kyle drops ‚ÄòOilers Collection 03‚Äô racing-inspired line
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, has unveiled "Oilers Collection 03," a new capsule inspired by classic motorsport style. The collection blends the Oilers' iconic colors with high-end streetwear and automotive aesthetics, drawing from vintage racing suits and team heritage. Kyle shared a preview on Instagram, highlighting the performance-driven fashion.

title: 'Will return after bail‚Äô: Rape-accused AAP MLA flees to Australia; escaped custody
content: AAP MLA Harmit Singh Pathanmajra, wanted in a rape case, is believed to have fled to Australia after a video interview. He denied allegations, calling it a political conspiracy, and stated he would return after securing bail. Police have issued a lookout notice and initiated proceedings to declare him a proclaimed offender.

title: UBT's Aditya Thackeray claims MMRDA's drone 'peeped into his house'
content: Aditya Thackeray objected to a drone flying over his Bandra East home, alleging it was "peeping into his home." Police clarified the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) was conducting a survey for a proposed pod taxi service. Thackeray questioned the lack of resident notification and the survey's purpose.

title: 'LoP means Leader of Partying': BJP's jibe at Congress; calls out Rahul Gandhi's Pachmarhi jungle safari
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party has criticised Rahul Gandhi's recent jungle safari in Madhya Pradesh. They labelled his position as 'Leader of Paryatan' or 'Leader of Partying'. The BJP claims this shows Congress's disconnect from electoral realities. They also allege that the party blames the Election Commission of India when facing electoral defeats.

title: 'Like Nehru, Indira': Tharoor on Advani's legacy; argues 'don't reduce career to one episode'
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor lauded veteran BJP leader LK Advani on his birthday. Tharoor compared Advani's legacy to that of Jawaharlal Nehru and Indira Gandhi. This drew criticism online, with some accusing him of downplaying Advani's controversial political history. Advani's 1990 Ram Rath Yatra and the subsequent Babri Masjid demolition remain significant events in India's past.

title: 'Sacrifice him & keep Dhruv Jurel': Ex-cricketer's brutal India Test XI call
content: Dhruv Jurel's twin centuries for India A against South Africa A have intensified the selection debate for the upcoming Test series. Former cricketer Aakash Chopra believes Jurel deserves a place in the XI, suggesting a middle-order alteration. Ravichandran Ashwin also praised Jurel's form, making it difficult for selectors to overlook him.

title: IGIA ATC glitch ‚Äî 'Critical need to prioritise modernisation': Air traffic managers raise red flag
content: Air traffic professionals are demanding urgent modernization of communication, navigation, and surveillance systems at major Indian airports, citing a recent Delhi ATC shutdown due to outdated technology. The Air Traffic Safety Electronic Personnel Association (ATSEPA) and the Air Traffic Controllers‚Äô Guild have repeatedly warned aviation authorities about systemic imbalances and the neglect of technical advice, impacting operational efficiency and safety margins amidst rapid air traffic growth.

title: 'He is more valuable than Bumrah': Former cricketer's remark sparks debate
content: Former Indian batter Subramaniam Badrinath lauded Varun Chakaravarthy, calling him the world's top T20I bowler and more valuable than Jasprit Bumrah. Badrinath highlighted Chakaravarthy's crucial role in restricting runs and taking wickets, especially during the recent series against Australia. He emphasized Chakaravarthy's significant comeback and his potential to be a key factor in the upcoming T20 World Cup.

title: Video: Moment tornado hit Brazil's Parana; six killed, hundreds injured
content: A devastating tornado has ripped through Brazil's Parana state, claiming at least six lives and injuring nearly 750 people. The powerful twister, with winds up to 250 km/h, obliterated 90% of Rio Bonito do Iguacu in less than a minute.  Aerial views show widespread destruction, with authorities fearing the death toll may climb as rescue efforts continue.

title: 'Have to speak the language they understand': RSS chief on Pakistan
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat issued a stern warning to Pakistan, stating India will respond firmly to provocations and must "speak the language they understand." He emphasised that consistent, firm responses will eventually compel Pakistan to cooperate rather than compete, asserting India's desire for peace while vowing to punish any breaches.

title: Record in Pakistan! Quinton de Kock equals MS Dhoni's rare feat
content: Quinton de Kock's triumphant return to international cricket sees him equal MS Dhoni's record of seven Player of the Series awards for a wicketkeeper in ODIs.  His stellar batting against Pakistan, including a century and two fifties, also propelled him past 7,000 ODI runs, marking him as a true elite performer.

title: Pistol, live cartridges recovered: ATS arrests 3 planning terror attacks across country
content: Gujarat ATS apprehended three suspects allegedly planning nationwide terrorist attacks. The trio, under surveillance for a year, were caught while supplying weapons. This arrest is part of a larger operation targeting arms smuggling and terror funding networks.

title: Pakistan‚Äôs manufacturing sector slumps; experts warn of long-term industrial decay
content: Pakistan's manufacturing sector faces a severe crisis, with private investment plummeting 46% in six years. Experts warn of industrial disintegration due to policy instability, high energy costs, and volatile currency. This decline threatens exports, jobs, and economic resilience, contrasting sharply with neighboring countries' growth.

title: After Darshan's viral pic, terror accused seen using smartphones inside Bengaluru jail
content: Videos of prisoners, including serial rapist Umesh Reddy and a terror case accused, using mobile phones inside Bengaluru's Central Prison have surfaced. This security lapse has prompted an inquiry into how the phones were provided and who is involved. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has ordered a report and action against those responsible.

title: IPL 2026 auction likely on Dec 15: WPL mega sale on Nov 27; big names released
content: The IPL 2026 auction is slated for December 15, with a potential return to India for the venue. Meanwhile, the Women's Premier League auction is scheduled for November 27 in Delhi, featuring key retentions and notable releases ahead of the event. This will be the first mega auction of the WPL since the inaugural auction.

title: ‚ÄòEven Hindu Dharma is not registered‚Äô: Mohan Bhagwat addresses row
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat defended the organization's status as a body of individuals, questioning the need for registration with the British government and highlighting post-independence recognition. He also addressed the 'Love Jihad' concept, attributing its perceived success to a failure in imparting Hindu values to children, while cautioning against generalizing about the Muslim community.

title: 'Saare badmash issi pe chalte hain': Haryana top cop on Thar, bullet bike
content: Haryana's top police officer, OP Singh, identified Mahindra Thars and Bullet motorcycles as high-risk vehicles often associated with reckless driving and rogue elements. He emphasized polite police checks and warned that drivers of these vehicles, along with high-performance cars, will face scrutiny. Singh also announced plans to bolster the state's cyber police unit.

title: Giants' 'Vintage White,' Broncos' throwbacks lead NFL Week 10 uniforms
content: the new york Giants first wore the combination in 2016 as part of the NFL's color rush program . but it took a one-year hiatus in 2024 . it includes blue numbers with a red outline, similar to what the franchise wore .

title: European soccer updates: Bournemouth struggling at Villa
content: We have one more day of matches across Europe before the international break, and Sunday is full of action. We start in the  Premier League  with  AFC Bournemouth  looking to go second in the table with a win over  Aston Villa , and at the same time  Brentford  take on  Newcastle United ,  Nottingham Forest  host  Leeds United  and  Brighton & Hove Albion  travel to  Crystal Palace . Then it's the big game of the day, with  Manchester City  looking to close the gap on leaders Arsenal against defending champions  Liverpool , who have struggled of late in the league. Meanwhile, in Spain's  LaLiga , we have league leaders  Real Madrid  taking on  Rayo Vallecano . Enjoy live updates from the big matches across Europe with ESPN.

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: Fantasy Football Buzz: When can we expect Puka Nacua, Brock Purdy back in the lineup?
content: a fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the league . he left the game halfway through the third quarter with what was described as a chest injury after going to the ground hard on top of the football .

title: The NFL at midseason: Separating the good, bad and ugly for all 32 teams
content: quarterback carousel spins in Arizona, New Orleans and San Francisco with injuries . quarterback jaxson Dart has impressed as a rookie QB in new york . the nfl is one of the strongest divisions halfway through the season . "get up" team reporters took part in a midseason reset .

title: Follow live: Colts, Falcons trading scores in Berlin
content: Sunday's action in Week 10 of the NFL season kicked off with the first regular-season game in Berlin, where the  Atlanta Falcons  and  Indianapolis Colts  face each other in a key game for both teams. It's the first game since the Colts traded for  Sauce Gardner , and it features  two of the top  running backs in the Colts'  Jonathan Taylor  and the Falcons'  Bijan Robinson . Here are some of the  scenes  from Berlin. This will be a  file updated throughout the day  with inactives for each game. Here is a look at all the highlights, analysis and key moments from this game and the rest of Sunday's action:

title: Izzo guides Michigan St. past Calipari, Arkansas
content: no. 22 Michigan State beat no. 14 Arkansas 69-66 in a matchup of Hall of Fame coaches . the Spartans grabbed 19 offensive rebounds and converted them into 18 points . freshmen darius Acuff Jr. and Meleek Thomas scored 16 points on 5-of-16 shooting .

title: Indiana's catch of the year, Oregon's escape: The B1G stole the show on Saturday
content: the big Ten is the sport's chief exporter of cheese, beef and punts . it's not that the Big Ten doesn't have good games, necessarily . the drama often feels more "Masterpiece Theater" than "Alien vs. Predator"

title: Spurs' Fox hits ground running, has 24 in debut
content: de'Aaron Fox is back in a 126-119 victory over the new Orleans pelicans . he led the Spurs with 24 points on 9-for-14 shooting in his first game since march 12 . the point guard was patient in his impatience, eager to make his season debut .
